archetype_name: Family Weekend Showstopper: Spanish & Portuguese Feasts
name: Portuguese Caldeirada de Peixe (Iberian Fisherman’s Stew) with Garlic Toasts
description: Layered Portuguese seafood stew with potatoes, peppers, and saffron in a rich fish broth, finished with fresh parsley and lemon. Served with crisp oven-toasted sourdough and aioli for dipping.
prep_steps: Slice 2 large onions into thin half-moons.
Slice 6 cloves garlic thinly; reserve 1 clove for the toasts.
Peel and slice 800 g potatoes into 1 cm rounds; rinse under cold water.
Cut 600 g fish fillets into large 4–5 cm chunks.
Slice 300 g squid into 1 cm rings.
Rinse 500 g mussels under cold water; discard any broken shells (if using ready-cooked, just drain).
Chop a small bunch of parsley; cut 1 lemon into wedges.
Slice sourdough bread into 12–16 slices; lightly brush with olive oil.
cook_steps: Heat 3 tbsp olive oil in a wide heavy pot over medium heat (StoveTop).
Soften onions with a pinch of salt for 8–10 min until translucent.
Stir in sliced garlic (reserve 1 clove for toast), bell peppers, and cook 4–5 min.
Add 1 can (400 g) diced tomatoes, 2 bay leaves, a pinch of saffron, 1 tsp black pepper, and 1.5 tsp salt; cook 3 min.
Pour in 250 ml white wine; simmer 3–4 min to reduce slightly.
Stir 2 tbsp fish stock concentrate into 1.2 liters water; add to the pot and bring to a gentle boil.
Layer potato slices into the pot so they are mostly submerged; reduce to a steady simmer, cover, and cook 15–18 min until potatoes are just tender.
Uncover; tuck in fish fillets and squid. Simmer gently 5 min.
Add mussels and prawns in an even layer. Cover and cook 5–7 min until mussels open and prawns are opaque. Discard any mussels that do not open.
Taste broth; adjust salt and black pepper as needed. Stir through most of the chopped parsley.
While seafood finishes, place oiled sourdough slices on a tray and bake 8–10 min at 200°C/400°F until golden (Oven). Rub the hot toasts with the reserved raw garlic clove.
Ladle the stew into a large serving bowl. Top with remaining parsley and serve with lemon wedges, garlic toasts, and aioli on the side.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C/400°F.
Slice 2 large onions into thin half-moons.
Slice 6 cloves garlic thinly; reserve 1 clove for the toasts.
Slice 2 bell peppers into strips.
Peel and slice 800 g potatoes into 1 cm rounds; rinse under cold water.
Cut 600 g fish fillets into large 4–5 cm chunks.
Slice 300 g squid into 1 cm rings.
Rinse 500 g mussels under cold water; discard any broken shells (if using ready-cooked, just drain).
Pat dry 400 g prawns.
Chop a small bunch of parsley; cut 1 lemon into wedges.
Slice sourdough bread into 12–16 slices; lightly brush with olive oil.
Heat 3 tbsp olive oil in a wide heavy pot over medium heat (StoveTop).
Soften onions with a pinch of salt for 8–10 min until translucent.
Stir in sliced garlic (reserve 1 clove for toast), bell peppers, and cook 4–5 min.
Add 1 can (400 g) diced tomatoes, 2 bay leaves, a pinch of saffron, 1 tsp black pepper, and 1.5 tsp salt; cook 3 min.
Pour in 250 ml white wine; simmer 3–4 min to reduce slightly.
Stir 2 tbsp fish stock concentrate into 1.2 liters water; add to the pot and bring to a gentle boil.
Layer potato slices into the pot so they are mostly submerged; reduce to a steady simmer, cover, and cook 15–18 min until potatoes are just tender.
Uncover; tuck in fish fillets and squid. Simmer gently 5 min.
Add mussels and prawns in an even layer. Cover and cook 5–7 min until mussels open and prawns are opaque. Discard any mussels that do not open.
Taste broth; adjust salt and black pepper as needed. Stir through most of the chopped parsley.
While seafood finishes, place oiled sourdough slices on a tray and bake 8–10 min at 200°C/400°F until golden (Oven). Rub the hot toasts with the reserved raw garlic clove.
Ladle the stew into a large serving bowl. Top with remaining parsley and serve with lemon wedges, garlic toasts, and aioli on the side.
